intro: Amomum calophrys, commonly known as the fragrant cardamom, is a perennial herb native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Zingiberaceae family, which includes ginger and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its tall, upright stems and broad, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are clustered in spikes and are typically greenish-white with a subtle fragrance. The rhizomes of Amomum calophrys are used in traditional medicine and as a spice, similar to other members of its family.
